game_description: ZOSU Ocean: - 30 ocean levels to explore, more of a relaxing experience than a game - Over 100 sea animals to save, the majority are randomly spawned - Over 60 minutes of timed gameplay in scoring mode - This is a relaxing game where you are ZOSU the explorer and you are collecting sea creatures to save them from extinction and to score points Controls: - Builtin right hand jetpack for movement. Jetpack body movement is set to the direction of your hand. - Walking and jumping movement is set to the direction you are looking. - Score points by collecting fish and finding randomly spawned treasure. Gameplay: - Timed scoring mode, 2 minutes per level with over 60 minutes of gameplay - Freeplay mode, no timer and no scoring - This is intended to be a relaxing game and there is no way to take damage or die - Sea creatures include starfish, dinosaurs, sharks, squid, many many common and exotic fish, and large sea mammals - Bonus island land lobby with climbing and level selection lobby
review_1: ZOSU Ocean is a very relaxing game in Virtual Reality. Zosu Ocean's Gameplay lets you collect species of animals in a time limit to help them from going extinct. Enjoy beautiful scenery and relaxing sounds! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jl2lFxymD20
review_3: This game is definitely not the most polished game you will find on App Lab. But it is simple, and a lot of fun for younger kids who love to cruise around the different underwater environments collecting different sea creatures. I wouldn't necessarily consider it an educational game, since there are a few issues in size and animal selection. (A hippo walking around the ocean floor for example) I also wish there was a better way to examine the animal models without them disappearing when you get to close and "collect" them.
review_4: As a game it is a little limited at the moment but it's actually just a wonderful way to relax swimming around finding an impressive amount of undersea life that you can get close to and collect. I honestly found myself just floating around in this cool underwater world more than trying to get any high score. Great way to relax :)
review_5: Kudos to the developer for this one - it made me smile from ear-to-ear. It's very much like a colorful dreamscape that I lost myself in for quite a few minutes. The fish don't move (they are animated but remain stationary) but that didn't detract from the overall experience. I did genuinely laugh out loud when I saw a hippo and the developers face on a fish! I wish you every success with your future projects - thank you for this, it was fun!
